snippet: American intelligence and counterterrorism officials said Islamic extremist groups were trying to identify, recruit and train Westerners to carry out attacks when they returned home.
abstract: American intelligence and counterterrorism officials say Islamic extremist groups in Syria with ties to Al Qaeda are trying to identify, recruit and train Americans and other Westerners who have traveled there to get them to carry out attacks when they return home; efforts are latest challenge that Syrian conflict has created for Europe and United States.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: American intelligence and counterterrorism officials said Islamic extremist groups were trying to identify, recruit and train Westerners to carry out attacks when they returned home.

headline.main: Syria Militants Said to Recruit Visiting Americans to Attack U.S.
headline.print_headline: Syria Militants Said to Recruit For U.S. Attack

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
